sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The rem (remainder] operator produces the remainder of one number divided by another. For example, 7 rem 2 produces 1 and -12 rem 5 produces -2.
sections.text_content: The rem (remainder] operator produces the remainder of one number divided by  another. For example, 7 rem 2 produces 1 and -12 rem 5 produces -2.
sections.mdown_content: The **rem** (*remainder*] operator produces the remainder of one number divided by  another. For example, 7 **rem** 2 produces 1 and -12 **rem** 5 produces -2.

sections.title: Example
code:
var eggCount : int
        get eggCount
        put "You have ", eggCount div 12, " dozen eggs"
        put "You have ", eggCount rem 12, " left over"
sections.raw_content: In this example, eggCount is the total number of eggs. The first put statement determines how many dozen eggs there are. The second put statement determines how many extra eggs there are beyond the last dozen.
sections.text_content: In this example, eggCount is the total number of eggs. The first put statement determines how many dozen eggs there are. The second put statement determines how many extra eggs there are beyond the last dozen.
sections.mdown_content: In this example, *eggCount* is the total number of eggs. The first **put** statement determines how many dozen eggs there are. The second **put** statement determines how many extra eggs there are beyond the last dozen.
